definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very

sentences.english: No suspected cancer cells or cancer cells were found.
sentences.chinese: 宫颈刮片检查两组均未查见可疑癌细胞或癌细胞。

sentences.english: In the arms of a suspect was arrested near the burial.
sentences.chinese: 一可疑人物在武器埋藏地附近被逮捕。

sentences.english: How Do You Report Suspected Tax Fraud Activity?
sentences.chinese: 如何举报可疑的税物造假行为？

sentences.english: Aloft in the air, as if from the depths of the cloud, came a confused and doubtful sound of voices.
sentences.chinese: 高空中，仿佛自云团深处，传来一片可疑的嘈杂人声。

sentences.english: He uses some dubious shifts to get money.
sentences.chinese: 他用一些可疑的手段去赚钱。

sentences.english: You get a lot of suspicious-looking people in this bar.
sentences.chinese: 你这个酒吧里有许多人看上去很可疑。

sentences.english: There were two or three suspicious characters hanging about the fairground.
sentences.chinese: 有两三个可疑分子在集市上闲逛。

sentences.english: Conclusion False-negative and suspicious types in embryo-cardiac surveillance could be decreased if the gravida eat before the test.
sentences.chinese: 结论可通过进食后复查来减少假阴性与可疑型病例。

sentences.english: They may seize and impound suspect products.
sentences.chinese: 他们可以查封并扣押可疑产品。

sentences.english: Some people are under the misapprehension that all politicians stink.
sentences.chinese: 有些人误会所有的政客都可疑。

sentences.english: Investors, for one thing, were dubious.
sentences.chinese: 投资者的一件事，是可疑的。

sentences.english: It was the spy's suspicious manner that first put us on to him.
sentences.chinese: 最初引起我们对这个间谍警惕的是他的可疑的举止。

sentences.english: The suspected cheating took place during this year's entrance exams.
sentences.chinese: 这起可疑的作弊事件发生在今年的高考中。

sentences.english: If you find something suspicious, will you be posting things yourself as the weeks go on?
sentences.chinese: 如果你发现可疑之处，会数周数周的记录吗？

sentences.english: The testimony given by him is dubious.
sentences.chinese: 他所作的证据是可疑的。

sentences.english: Two suspicious-looking fellows were seen hanging around the campus .
sentences.chinese: 昨夜有人看见两个形迹可疑的人在校园徘徊。

definition: to inspect/to run through a checklist/to take stock/to audit
to follow a trail/to trace/to pursue
to try to find out/to trace/to track down
to cover up/to conceal/to go into hiding
